variant.question:
What is the correct completion of the definition of an instrument approach manoeuvre?
Instrument approach procedure means a series of pre-determined manoeuvres by reference to flight instruments with specified protection from obstacles from initial approach fix (IAF), or where applicable, from the...

options.text: beginning of a defined arrival route to a point from which a landing can be completed and thereafter, if a landing is no completed, to a position at which holding or en-route obstacle clearance criteria apply.
beginning of a defined arrival route to a point from which a landing can be completed.

end of a defined departure route to a point from which a landing can be completed and thereafter, if a landing is not completed, to a position at which holding or en-route obstacle clearance criteria apply.
end of a defined departure route to a point from which a landing can be completed.

variant.question:
Prior to commencing the approach, the pilot of an aircraft says to the Air Traffic Services Unit (ATSU) at the planned destination aerodrome 
'Please, call a taxi for us. We will arrive on schedule at 1045.'
Can this be considered a Flight Regularity Message??

options.text: No, because individual requirements of passengers or crew shall NOT be admissible in this type of message.
No, because this type of message can only be passed once the aircraft is on the ground and passed onto the DELIVERY controller.
Yes, provided the ATSU has responsibility for ground handling services at the planned destination aerodrome.
Yes, because this is information for a representative of the aircraft`s operating agency and may be relayed by the ATSU.

variant.question: What is the meaning of APV?

options.text: “””Approach procedure with vertical guidance””: an instrument procedure which utilises lateral and vertical guidance but does not meet the requirements established for precision approach and landing operations.”
“””Approach performed only in VMC””: the restriction of an approved procedure to land at an aerodrome only when the aerodrome`s ATS unit reports VFR meteorological conditions.”

“””Aerodrome probable visibility””: the visibility used in case of failure of visibility-measuring instruments at an aerodrome, based on estimates by a human observer with knowledge of the aerodrome environment.”

“””Aerodrome proximity visualisation””: an augmented-reality visualisation through any computer-based system of the essential elements at or in the close vicinity of an aerodrome, such as obstacles and signs.”

variant.question: What is the meaning of APV?

options.text: “Approach procedure with vertical guidance”: an instrument procedure which utilises lateral and vertical guidance but does not meet the requirements established for precision approach and landing operations.

“Aerodrome probable visibility”: the visibility used in case of failure of visibility-measuring instruments at an aerodrome, based on estimates by a human observer with knowledge of the aerodrome environment.

“Aerodrome proximity visualisation”: an augmented-reality visualisation through any computer-based system of the essential elements at or in the close vicinity of an aerodrome, such as obstacles and signs.
“Approach performed only in VMC”: the restriction of an approved procedure to land at an aerodrome only when the aerodrome`s ATS unit reports VFR meteorological conditions.”

variant.question:
The pilot of a jet transport aeroplane is in cruise flight at FL330 when he receives the aural alert “Traffic, traffic”. Looking at his navigation display, he observes an amber circle labelled ↓+8
Select the correct statement.

options.text: TCAS has issued a traffic advisory for conflicting traffic 800 ft above and descending towards the aeroplane. The pilot shall try to establish visual contact to the conflict traffic and be prepared for possible resolution advisories.
TCAS has issued a traffic advisory. The conflict traffic is 800 ft above and the pilot is instructed to descend in order to increase the clearance. He shall inform ATC by the phrase “TCAS DESCENT”.
TCAS has issued a resolution advisory. The pilot is instructed to descend at a vertical rate of more than 800 ft/min to avoid the conflict traffic. He shall inform ATC with the phrase “TCAS RA”.

TCAS has issued a resolution advisory. The conflict traffic is 800 ft below and climbing towards the aeroplane. The pilot shall immediately initiate a climb and inform ATC using the phrase “TCAS CLIMB”.

variant.question: <span>What does ACARS mean?
<span>What does TCAS mean?
What does the word 'negative' mean ?

options.text: Consider that transmission as not sent.

variant.question: What is the correct phrase to use over the intercom between the flight deck and ground crew when you want the tractor to reverse you off the parking stand?
What do you reply when an aeronautical station initiates a SELCAL transmission?
ATC asks you: "Advise able RNAV offset". What does this mean?

options.text: ATC is asking if you can accept a parallel route offset from a standard route.
ATC is asking if you can turn your RNAV equipment off.
ATC is asking if you can fly in RVSM.
ATC is asking you if you can fly with a new a relative heading, provided by ATC.

variant.question: What is the correct radio transmission to be made to ATC by the pilot when ready for pushback, (if local procedures require it)?
You are 8 NM from threshold and just established on final approach. What is the correct term to inform the tower?
When shall the phrase "TAKEOFF" be used by a pilot?

options.text: Never, it is used only by the control tower.
Only when the aircraft has already moved onto the active runway.
To inform TOWER when ready for departure.

variant.question: You are in the aircraft and switched your radio to the ground monitoring the frequency. Which of the following messages are PBN related?

options.text: Tower, Primair 350, UNABLE RNAV due equipment.
Primair 350, taxi holding point Alpha runway 30.
Primair 350, cleared destination via the DSX5U departure, ACU9C transition, climb initially 4 000 ft and squawk 1000.
Primair 350, hold position and monitor tower.

variant.question:
Just after landing, ATC transmits to you the following instruction:
'Expedite taxi, traffic on final Runway 28, report Runway 28 vacated'. 
This means...

options.text: taxi faster in order to vacate the runway quickly.
immediately stop taxiing to avoid a loss of separation with a landing aircraft on Runway 28.
you have priority on the runway over other traffic.

variant.question: A request "WORDS TWICE" means:

options.text: communication is difficult, please send every word or group of words twice.
readback of transmissions is no longer to be used.
communication is difficult, please send all transmissions twice.
communication is difficult, reduce your rate of speech to twice the time.

variant.question: ATC ask if you are able to proceed parallel offset. What does this mean?

options.text: Can you maintain a track parallel to the one you have been cleared on.
Can you join formation with another aircraft travelling in the same direction.
Can you rejoin track under own navigation if cleared off track.
Can you join the localiser offset for a parallel approach.

variant.question: According to RTF standard phraseology what is the meaning of 'CONFIRM'?

options.text: request verification of the clearance, the instruction, the action or the information
Repeat all of the last transmission.
You suspect there may be a possible problem.
I have ended my transmission and expect an answer.

variant.question: You receive the following clearance from ATC: “G-ABCD, turn right heading 050, traffic in your 10 o’clock position from left to right, Gulfstream G150, descending”. You have a TCAS traffic advisory. What will be your reply?
During an approach procedure, the radar controller instructs the flight crew as follows: STANDBY FOR MUDPARK PRECISION THIS FREQUENCY Which of the following actions of the flight crew is correct?

options.text: They will remain silent and wait for a different controller to call on the current frequency in use.
They will change the frequency to the one which is published for MUDPARK PRECISION and establish communications on that frequency.
They will acknowledge the call and wait for a different controller to call the current frequency in use.
They will change the frequency to the one which is published for MUDPARK PRECISION and wait for the controller to be called on that frequency.

variant.question: ATC reports traffic. Which phrase should be used if a pilot wants to inform ATC that he/she can see the corresponding traffic?
When cleared for an immediate take-off from the holding point you should:

options.text: taxi onto the runway for an immediate rolling take-off.
taxi onto the runway and commence your take-off run within 30 seconds of clearance.
taxi onto the runway to be airborne within 30 seconds of clearance.
taxi onto the runway and take-off as soon as possible, completing only mandatory power checks.

variant.question: The ATC informs the pilot that there is traffic at 11 o'clock. The pilot doesn't see it but has it on TCAS. How should the pilot reply?
Which term should pilots use during an approach when the aircraft is 15 km from touchdown?

ATC gives the following instruction "Fastair 123 traffic 9 o clock, 5 miles, opposite direction, same level,  report in sight". You do not see the traffic but you have a TCAS TA from the traffic. Your response is:
<span>In the event that a controller issued a clearance or an instruction contradictory to the TCAS Resolution Advisory (RA), the flight crew will follow the RA and inform the controller:

You are on the approach for landing and you get a warning that the undercarriage might not be down. You request the tower a flyby. Which of the following statements covers the correct phraseology and order of information?

options.text: “3x Pan Pan - Station call sign - your Callsign - Reason - Intention - ...”
“Pan Pan - Station call sign - your Callsign - Intention - Reason - ...”
“3x Pan Pan Medical - Station call sign - your Callsign - Reason - Intention - ... “
“3x Mayday - Station call sign - your Callsign - Intention - Reason - ... “

variant.question:
An aircraft is approaching Otopeni, the destination aerodrome, and has received the following ATIS broadcast. What is the runway in use for departures and on which frequency will you contact delivery? 
  
 ‘’OTOPENI INFORMATION OSCAR. 
 TIME 12:50 
 EXPECT AN ILS APPROACH. 
 ARRIVALS RUNWAY 08 RIGHT. DEPARTURES RUNWAY 08 LEFT 
 TRANSITION ALTITUDE 4000 FT. 
 WORK IN PROGRESS ON APRON TWO. 
 SURFACE WIND 250, 14 KNOTS. 
 VISIBILITY 10 KILOMETRES OR MORE. 
 SCATTERED 2400 FEET, BROKEN 4600 FEET. 
 CUMULONIMBUS DETECTED. 
 TEMPERATURE +19, DEW POINT +4. 
 QNH 1007 
 NO SIGNIFICANT CHANGE 
 ACKNOWLEDGE RECEIPT OF INFORMATION OSCAR WITH APP ON 119.415. 
 DEPARTURE WITH DELIVERY ON 121.955.‘’
The phrase "BRAKING COEFFICIENT 25" from ATC means that the braking action is:
The phrase "FRICTION COEFFICIENT 35" from ATC means that the braking action is:

Which option is correct as regards the following D-ATIS?
WSSS Dep ATIS F
0130 METAR
Exp ILS Apch segregrated PARL Ops in use
ARR RWY 02L DEP 02C
Taxiing guidance lights on all taxiways are on for lighting inspection
Junction of TWY EP and A3 including rapid exit TWY E3 Southbound CLSD due WIP
Wind 010 04 KT GUST 23 WIND DIR 320 V 040
10 KM FEW 1600 FT
T 27 / DP 26 QNH 1012 NOSIG
ARR to ACK INFO E with APP on 120.3 and DEP with DELIVERY on 121.65

options.text: The ATIS is for an aerodrome with ICAO code WSSS; taxiway E3 southbound is closed; clouds reported are FEW at 1600 ft.
ATIS message F is current; the temperature is 26° C; and no significant changes are expected regarding weather conditions in the next two hours.
The ATIS is for departing and arriving traffic; Runway 02C is in use for departures; departures have to acknowledge they have received information F with Approach Control.
Runway 02L is in use for departures; visibility is 10 km or more; wind direction is 010° and wind speed is 4 kt.

variant.question:
G-ABCD is wating for ATC to report the runway RVR, the pilot should expect the following:
"G-ABCD runway RVR................"

"PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille, F-GTPO, losing engine power, requesting immediate landing runway 20, right hand base for runway 20".
What type of message is the above?

On approach your pre-landing checks reveal that the landing gear may not be fully lowered. You are going to request a fly by of the tower for a visual inspection to confirm gear status. Which of the following would be the correct level and sequence of your message?

options.text: Pan pan (x3), Station being called, your callsign, reason, intentions...
Mayday (x3), station being called, your callsign, reason, intentions...
Pan pan (x3), your callsign, station being called,  reason, intentions...
Mayday (x3), station being called, reason, intentions, your callsign...

variant.question:
F-GTPO has already been in contact with Lille Tower, and sends the following message 

'PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille Tower, F-HDJF, smoke on board, right hand base for runway 20,requesting immediate landing runway 20.' 

Which of the following statements is correct as regards the compliance of the message with the standards for urgency and emergency transmissions?

options.text: The order of the elements in this urgency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.
The order of the elements in this urgency message is correct.
The order of the elements in this emergency message is incorrect, if possible, the present position shall follow the intentions of the person in command.
The order of the elements in this emergency message is correct.

variant.question: You are on an approach for landing, and you receive a warning that the undercarriage might not be down. You request the tower for a flyby. Which of the following answers covers the correct phraseology and order or information?

options.text: PAN PAN x3, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, the reason for the distress, intentions.
MAYDAY x3, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, the reason for the distress, intentions.
PAN PAN PAN, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, the reason for the distress, intentions.
MAYDAY x3, station’s call sign, aircraft’s call sign, request immediate flyby.

variant.question: An aircraft, callsign SP-ABC, has already been in contact with Lille tower and is now transmitting the following message: "PAN PAN, PAN PAN, PAN PAN, Lille Tower, SP-ABC, smoke on board, right hand base for runway 22, request immediate landing runway 22." Which of the following messages is correct, when considering the compliance of the message with the standards for urgency and emergency transmissions?

options.text: The order of the items in this urgency message is wrong, if possible, the present position should follow the intentions of the pilot.
The order of the items in this emergency message is wrong, if possible, the present position should follow the intentions of the pilot.
The order of the items in this urgency message is correct.
The order of the items in this emergency message is correct.

variant.question: According to ICAO, a transmission for a medical transport flight should start with the phrase “PAN PAN”, preferably spoken three times and followed by the other elements listed below. What is the preferred sequence for these other elements? - Total 1, Type Beech 200 - F-GHES - UN786 EDF CARES TIRPY - Flight time 02:46, ETD 10:00, ETA 12:46 - Current position, 45 NM south of Tirana - Maintain FL 360, squawk **0652** - Medical
